TopicTitle: List of places and biomes in KSP (planetary geology & geography) - UPDATING FOR v1.0.x.

Articles.Content: This will be semi-useful to Crowd Sourced Science. A rep to you!

If it hasn't changed from 0.25: Every Building on KSC is its own biome, distinct from the biome its standing on. even Water Towers. try it out. There are VAB-WaterTower, LaunchPadFlagPole, SPH-Tanks, everything. KSC alone has over 30 biomes in total. maybe even 40

If it hasn't changed from 0.25: Every Building on KSC is its own biome, distinct from the biome its standing on. even Water Towers. try it out. There are VAB-WaterTower, LaunchPadFlagPole, SPH-Tanks, everything. KSC alone has over 30 biomes in total. maybe even 40

Let me look at those too, I only checked all the buildings via ground. Have to check the extra 'props' (Tanks, Flags, etc.) also the roof off the VAB. Also have to check the old KSC and the KSC island. I'll do it in a sec.

I love the new biomes -- very cool, I've been frustrated by their lack for years. But (and there had to be a 'but' didn't there?) . . . How come there's only like 4 or 5 biomes at Duna? I have to admit to have been a little disappointed when I arrived there in my new 0.90 career game last night. I mean, shouldn't there be more biomes on Duna than there are on Ike? (This is not an argument to descope Ike biomes, they're great!).

I love the new biomes -- very cool, I've been frustrated by their lack for years. But (and there had to be a 'but' didn't there?) . . . How come there's only like 4 or 5 biomes at Duna? I have to admit to have been a little disappointed when I arrived there in my new 0.90 career game last night. I mean, shouldn't there be more biomes on Duna than there are on Ike? (This is not an argument to descope Ike biomes, they're great!).

This came to my mind too. It is just simply counter-intuitive to have less Places to go on a Planet than on ist neighboring Moon. :/

Updated my biome list for kerbin.

  • Added 31 new biomes for only the KSC.
  • Added Island Airstrip
  • Added Jeb's Retreat Launch Base

Still not complete would be wonderfull if squad helped !

Edited December 19, 2014 by Olympic1

If it hasn't changed from 0.25: Every Building on KSC is its own biome, distinct from the biome its standing on. even Water Towers. try it out. There are VAB-WaterTower, LaunchPadFlagPole, SPH-Tanks, everything. KSC alone has over 30 biomes in total. maybe even 40
Let me look at those too, I only checked all the buildings via ground. Have to check the extra 'props' (Tanks, Flags, etc.) also the roof off the VAB. Also have to check the old KSC and the KSC island. I'll do it in a sec.

Yep, did some research and found 31 new biomes on KSC only (Water towers, tanks, radar dishes, R&D buildings, flags).

I think that the building biomes are even increasing if you upgrade a building. Have to reset the buildings in the config.

This came to my mind too. It is just simply counter-intuitive to have less Places to go on a Planet than on ist neighboring Moon. :/

You could make the argument that the lifeless atmosphere causes mixing of surface materials, leading to fewer distinct biomes.

• Added 31 new biomes for only the KSC.
  • Added Island Airstrip
  • Added Jeb's Retreat Launch Base

31... cripes. Can you get science for all of those?

31... cripes.

Ugh -- why all this effort on biomes on Kerbin? The game's Kerbal Space Program, not Kerbin Geological Survey . . .
Hey, can you add the region names the way the game calls them? That would be great.
What is Jeb's Retreat? KSC2?

31... cripes. Can you get science for all of those?

yep, all of those biomes gives you science

Ugh -- why all this effort on biomes on Kerbin? The game's Kerbal Space Program, not Kerbin Geological Survey . . .

Those biomes are really helpfull for the beginning, because you can get A LOT of science by just walking/driving around KSC and taking EVA reports and surface samples. I got almost 1000 science by just doing that.

Hey, can you add the region names the way the game calls them? That would be great.

What do you mean?

What is Jeb's Retreat? KSC2?

It's not KSC2, I have to go there still. And Jeb's Retreat is something I found in my science logs.

The biome list is complete and I'll repost it in here.

With the help of KSP's cheats to see the biomes, HyperEdit for "fast travel" and MechJeb to see the biome names, I have a list of the different biomes on the planets and moons.

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text.RegularExpressions;
using UnityEngine;

namespace Biomes
{
[KSPAddon(KSPAddon.Startup.SpaceCentre, false)]
public class Class1 : MonoBehaviour
{
private void Start()
{
foreach (CelestialBody b in FlightGlobals.Bodies)
{
print(b.theName + " Biomes:");
print("--------------------");
CBAttributeMapSO map = b.BiomeMap;
if (map != null)
{
foreach (CBAttributeMapSO.MapAttribute att in map.Attributes)
{
string name = att.name;
string shortName = Regex.Replace(name, @"\s+", "");
print(shortName);
}
print("--------------------");
print("");
}
else
print("No Biomes Found For " + b.theName);
}
}
}
}

With the 0.90 update there are 101 new biomes. In total there are 137 biomes.

I'm might be wrong, but I think you forgot: LaunchPadFlagPole, LaunchPadTanks, LaunchPadWaterTower, LaunchPadRoundTank, AdministrationMainBuilding(Roof), AstronautComplexBuilding(roof)

TBH I really don't like the KSC biomes. They could include different reports for them but they should yield 0 Science Points. You might think the Kerbals build these buildings themselfes, so there is nothing new to discover there.

Instead of this, they could add natural sites, that behave like the KSC biomes now. For example: The peak of a vulcano is an actual object like a building and has such a building-biome. like anomalies with biomes just so that they are representing natural intersting places. Some more examples:

-Volcano peak , Crater-central-hill, Geysier ( Eeloo) , highest peak on planet, caves ,

lets call them : Places of Interest

to small to be a biome, and you'll only get Science when actually AT these location and not from high above them , like the buildings now.

And in exchange change the buildings to yield 0 Science

would be my suggestion for Squad.

I'm might be wrong, but I think you forgot: LaunchPadFlagPole, LaunchPadTanks, LaunchPadWaterTower, LaunchPadRoundTank, AdministrationMainBuilding(Roof), AstronautComplexBuilding(roof)

TBH I really don't like the KSC biomes. They could include different reports for them but they should yield 0 Science Points. You might think the Kerbals build these buildings themselfes, so there is nothing new to discover there.

-Volcano peak , Crater-central-hill, Geysier ( Eeloo) , highest peak on planet, caves ,

lets call them : Places of Interest

to small to be a biome, and you'll only get Science when actually AT these location and not from high above them , like the buildings now.

And in exchange change the buildings to yield 0 Science

would be my suggestion for Squad.

I did check these but didn't get any biome from them. But as you're saying they aren't very meaningfull even if they give you science, I just added them to let you guys know they exist.

TBH I really don't like the KSC biomes. They could include different reports for them but they should yield 0 Science Points. You might think the Kerbals build these buildings themselfes, so there is nothing new to discover there.

Some of us use them.

Mostly to chide you for not doing real science, but nevertheless, they can serve a purpose.

Have there been any new additions to these KSC biomes since 0.25? I didn't check very carefully, but your list looks the same as what were there in that version.

Some of us use them.

Mostly to chide you for not doing real science, but nevertheless, they can serve a purpose.

Have there been any new additions to these KSC biomes since 0.25? I didn't check very carefully, but your list looks the same as what were there in that version.

No, there weren't new additions to the KSC biomes, only that they are now building level bounded. So more KSC biomes come if you upgrade a building.

My suspicion is that the plethora of "biomes" around the KSC may be accidental. Now that buildings are upgradable, it might have been advantageous for the computer code to treat each building as a biome, but was never intended for actual in-game effects.

The science return for each individual biome is small, IIRC, but it does become a problem in aggregate. Perhaps a bug/exploit report is in order?

My suspicion is that the plethora of "biomes" around the KSC may be accidental. Now that buildings are upgradable, it might have been advantageous for the computer code to treat each building as a biome, but was never intended for actual in-game effects.

The science return for each individual biome is small, IIRC, but it does become a problem in aggregate. Perhaps a bug/exploit report is in order?

Nope. It's not something that would happen by accident. Registering those areas as different biomes requires a completely different method than simply looking up the current biome based on lat/long location.
Gib save file plox!!!

So, is there a consensus about the current situation for Kerbal Space Center? If you have solid and complete info, please post it as a short and informative post, so I don't have to sift and decypher stuff when I update the main post where all the data is.

High resolution maps (ScanSat or whatever) would be most helpful, so if you're into scanning, start scanning.

I'll be working on heights limits as always.

p.s.: also be sure to check whether the existing data is correct
